text: The Latin Bishopric of Coron or Diocese of Coronea () was a Roman Catholic diocese located in the town of Coron in Messenia, Peloponnese, Greece,"Diocese of Coron (Coronea)" Catholic-Hierarchy.org. David M. Cheney. Retrieved June 16, 2016"Titular Episcopal See of Coronea" GCatholic.org. Gabriel Chow. Retrieved June 16, 2016 during its rule by the Republic of Venice. Following the Ottoman conquest in 1500, it was suppressed; in 1933, it was restored as a titular see. ==Ordinaries== *Paolo Foscari (24 Apr 1366 Appointed - 7 May 1367 Bishop of Castello) *Bartolomeo Lopaci, O.P. (27 Jun 1449 Appointed - 1457 Resigned)"Bishop Bartolomeo Lopaci, O.P." Catholic-Hierarchy.org. David M. Cheney. Retrieved August 3, 2016 *Giovanni Ducco (7 Jun 1479 Appointed - 21 Jan 1496 Died)"Bishop Giovanni Ducco" Catholic-Hierarchy.org. David M. Cheney. title: Latin Bishopric of Coron
